RECREATIONAL.summary: It is illegal for adults to possess cannabis in Alabama. State law classifies marijuana as a Schedule I controlled substance, and possession for personal use is a Class A misdemeanor punishable by up to one year in jail and a $6,000 fine. There is no exception for adult recreational possession; only registered medical cannabis patients may possess certain non-smokable forms of medical cannabis.
RECREATIONAL.gov_quote: "A person commits the crime of unlawful possession of marijuana in the second degree if, except as otherwise authorized, he or she possesses marijuana for his or her personal use only."
